settingsPane.description: The following settings control CPU hotplug parameters. Depending on the following parameters, the second core is enabled or disabled.
settingsPane.name: CPU Hotplug Settings

spinner.description: Sets the CPU Hotplug Mode. Hotplug mode will dynamically switch the second core on and off. Using second core always-off or always-on modes will make the other hotplug parameters useless.
spinner.name: Hotplug Mode

settingsPane.description: The following settings are for all global CPU configuration, use it only if you know what you are doing.
settingsPane.name: CPU Global Settings

seekBar.description: Maximum CPU Speed (default is 1200)
seekBar.name: scaling_max_freq

seekBar.description: Minimum CPU Speed (default is 200)
seekBar.name: scaling_min_freq

spinner.description: This sets the smooth scaling level which prevents ondemand based governors to jump directly to maximum frequency, with load spikes. This setting will only change the behavior of ondemand and pegasusq governors.
spinner.name: Smooth Scaling Level

spinner.description: This will set the AWAKE (screen ON) CPU governor. Default CPU governor will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution), and can be overridden by later scripts or apps.
spinner.name: Default CPU Governor

seekBar.description: second core will be enabled when the load goes above this threshold (default is 30)
seekBar.name: load_h0

seekBar.description: second core will be disabled when the load goes below this threshold (default is 20)
seekBar.name: load_l1

seekBar.description: (default is 2)
seekBar.name: min_rq

seekBar.description: (default is 20)
seekBar.name: load_rq

seekBar.description: Sets hot plug sampling intervals for screen-on state (default is 100)
seekBar.name: rate

seekBar.description: Sets the frequency below which second core will not be turned on, regardless of thresholds. (default: 100000)
seekBar.name: freq_min

settingsPane.description: These settings control CFS (Complete Fair Scheduler) Task Scheduler Settings
settingsPane.name: CFS Settings

checkbox.description: Disabling GENTLE_FAIR_SLEEPERS may give you better UI responsiveness.
checkbox.name: GENTLE_FAIR_SLEEPERS
checkbox.label: GENTLE_FAIR_SLEEPERS

checkbox.description: Using ARCH_POWER enables the use of arm topology power functions instead of generic ones.
checkbox.name: ARCH_POWER
checkbox.label: ARCH_POWER

settingsPane.description: Here you can set all the settings for power save!
settingsPane.name: CPU Idle and Power Settings

seekBar.description: This is for CPU under voltage to save power, 0=Overvolt! +75mV -> 5=big undervolt! -50mV use it in your own risk! Warning if you want to use the simple undervolting below, please leave this setting as DEFAULT=3!
seekBar.name: asv_group

spinner.description: Sets the CPU undervolting value which will be set during boot time only. It will not have any effect until you restart your device. Remember: if you change this value and your device doesn't boot you will have to reset extweaks settings using CWM recovery. This value will be applied to all CPU steps before any script or app execution. If you use any script or voltage control app this setting may be overridden by those.
spinner.name: CPU Undervolting

spinner.description: Sets the CPU Idle Mode. AFTR+LPA is the default and best for the battery life but if you have problems try Idle+LPA.
spinner.name: CPU Idle Mode

seekBar.description: Sets the sched_mc value which changes the cpu scheduler behavior for multi-cpu systems. 0 is Samsung kernel's default value which turns sched_mc off. Setting it to 1 means that the first core will be fully loaded before SEC CPU will start, and setting it to 2 will bias task wake-ups to semi-idle cpu package for power savings. (default: 0)
seekBar.name: sched_mc

seekBar.description: This is for CPU BUS-FREQ 400,267,133 MHz, 0=MAX Power(400MHz) -> 3=MAX-Battery Save(133MHz), default=3(133MHz)
seekBar.name: busfreq_asv_group

seekBar.description: This is for CPU BUS-FREQ UP-FREQ-Scaling, based on CPU load! default=30%
seekBar.name: busfreq_up_threshold

seekBar.description: This is for CPU BUS-FREQ DOWN-FREQ-Scaling, based on CPU load! default=30%
seekBar.name: busfreq_down_threshold

seekBar.description: Maximum DEEP SLEEP CPU Speed (only 500 or 600 default is 600)
seekBar.name: scaling_max_suspend_freq

seekBar.description: Minimum DEEP SLEEP CPU Speed (default is 200)
seekBar.name: scaling_min_suspend_freq

spinner.description: This will set the DEEP-SLEEP (screen OFF) CPU governor, depend on cortex background process ON.
spinner.name: Deep-Sleep! CPU Governor

settingsPane.description: GPU Frequency Settings. Normally, our device has 2 frequency steps. This Kernel has three steps but the third step is not enabled as default. The defaults are 160,267 and 267. Voltage defaults are 950mV, 1000mV and 1000mV.
settingsPane.name: GPUFreq

spinner.description: Changes the first (lowest) GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step1

spinner.description: Changes the second (middle) GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step2

spinner.description: Changes the third (last) GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step3

checkbox.description: Lock GPU Freq to 267MHz on screen wakeup or leave it as set for 1st level
checkbox.name: GPU WAKEUP FREQ
checkbox.label: GPU WAKEUP FREQ

settingsPane.description: GPU Voltage Levels: The defaults are 950,1050 and 1050.
settingsPane.name: GPU Voltage Levels

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the first (lowest) step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level1

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the second (middle) step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level2

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the third (highest) step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level3

settingsPane.description: GPU load thresholds to change between frequency steps. The third step is disabled as default by having the second to third threshold 100.
settingsPane.name: GPU Thresholds

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from first to second step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 1-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from second to first step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 2-DOWN

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from second to third step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 2-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from third to second step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 3-DOWN

settingsPane.description: The number of cycles that the GPU stays at the specific level. The defaults are all 0
settingsPane.name: GPU StayCount

seekBar.description: GPU first (for the lowest freq) StayCount
seekBar.name: GPU StayCount1

seekBar.description: GPU second (for the middle freq) StayCount
seekBar.name: GPU StayCount2

seekBar.description: GPU third (for the highest freq) StayCount
seekBar.name: GPU StayCount3

settingsPane.description: Brightness Curve settings which modify auto-brightness behavior.
settingsPane.name: Brightness Curve

seekBar.description: Sets touch screen move sensitivity (vitalij value).
seekBar.name: TouchMove Sensitivity

seekBar.description: Setting min_bl higher will result in staying lowest brightness level for brighter conditions (default 30)
seekBar.name: min_bl

seekBar.description: Minimum brightness level (default 0)
seekBar.name: min_gamma

seekBar.description: Maximum brightness level (default 24)
seekBar.name: max_gamma

settingsPane.description: Settings for screen color by user manual input
settingsPane.name: Screen Color Menu

button.description: Push to reset screen color to default
button.name: Reset Color to Default
button.label: Default Color

seekBar.description: Sets screen BLUE color scale (Default is 132)
seekBar.name: Blue Color Scale

seekBar.description: Sets screen RED color scale (Default is 122)
seekBar.name: Red Color Scale

settingsPane.description: Other Settings
settingsPane.name: Other Settings

seekBar.description: User adjustable gamma shift.
seekBar.name: Gamma Shift

seekBar.description: Vibration force level (default 75)
seekBar.name: Vibration Force

seekBar.description: Sets Touch screen cpu freq, when you touch the screen CPU will be boosted to that speed! if you are using luzactive gov set this to max CPU you like to use! or it's will be stuck on this limit! default is 500000mHz)
seekBar.name: Touch screen lock freq

checkbox.description: Enable inverting the screen colors by quickly pressing Home button below configured times
checkbox.name: mDNIe Negative Toggle
checkbox.label: mDNIe Negative Toggle

spinner.description: Negative Color, Screen effect settings, Fast Click MENU for number of times configured to activate MOD
spinner.name: Negative Screen Mod tuning.

settingsPane.description: Touch screen configuration on BATT and on CHARGE, !ALERT! wrong set will disable touch screen! and you will have too reset profiles in recovery! Also settings for Battery VS Charger are different! do not set the same levels! have fun tuning.
settingsPane.name: Touch Screen Sensitivity

seekBar.description: Touch Screen on BATTERY (Touch Treshold) (default=50)
seekBar.name: BATT Touch Treshold

seekBar.description: Touch Screen on BATTERY (Noise Treshold) (default=40)
seekBar.name: BATT Noise Treshold

seekBar.description: Touch Screen on BATTERY (Move Filter) (default=14)
seekBar.name: BATT Move Filter

seekBar.description: Touch Screen on CHARGER/USB (Touch Treshold) (default=53)
seekBar.name: CHRG Touch Treshold

seekBar.description: Touch Screen on CHARGER/USB (Noise Treshold) (default=38)
seekBar.name: CHRG Noise Treshold

seekBar.description: Touch Screen on CHARGER/USB (Move Filter) (default=46)
seekBar.name: CHRG Move Filter

settingsPane.description: Headphone Amplification Settings Thanks to Gokhanmoral!
settingsPane.name: Headphone Amplification

seekBar.description: Headphone Amplifier Level (0-3 which corresponds to 0-1.5-3-6dB)
seekBar.name: Headphone Amplifier

settingsPane.description: Back Light Notification Settings
settingsPane.name: Back Light Notification(BLN)

checkbox.description: BackLightNotification Switch
checkbox.name: BLN
checkbox.label: BLN

spinner.description: Back Light Notification switch, will work on Battery/Charger/USB
spinner.name: BLN MODE Switch

checkbox.description: Back Light Notification will work when on Charger/USB if above switch is OFF or ON
checkbox.name: BLN on Charger
checkbox.label: BLN Enabled on charging

spinner.description: Notification timeout. -1: disabled
spinner.name: Notification Timeout

spinner.description: This setting will set renew notification timeout yes/no.
spinner.name: BLN Notification Reset

spinner.description: This setting will set BL Notification always ON, with charger, OFF/ON.
spinner.name: BLN Notification on charger

spinnerItem.name: BLN no timeout OFF, on charger
BLN no timeout ON, on charger

spinner.description: Back Light Notification OFF on low battery or ignore battery level
spinner.name: BLN Battery Check

button.description: Use this button to test bln. BLN will be active after you turn the screen off.
button.name: Test BLN
button.label: Test BLN

settingsPane.description: Touch Keys Light Settings, here you can set the way touch keys light work
settingsPane.name: Touch Keys Lights Settings

checkbox.description: Selecting this will activate turning touckey leds on when you touch the screen (only when led timeout is enabled) value from led timeout will be used for this mod.
checkbox.name: Leds on with touch
checkbox.label: led-on-touch

spinner.description: Led timeout. Leave it disabled if your ROM already has led timeout support. In CM9, if you have lights enabled screen brightness changes may trigger lights on. It is normal. If you want them to stay disabled you have to disable leds in CM9 menu.
spinner.name: led_timeout

checkbox.description: Led fadeout effect. If you are on a Samsung ROM, you need to set touch keys leds to always on or always off, and use led timeout in ExTweaks.
checkbox.name: led-fadeout
checkbox.label: Led Fadeout effect

seekBar.description: Controls touchpad led voltage level (default: 3000)
seekBar.name: Led Voltage Level

settingsPane.description: Dual Mount-SDCARD and MMC via USB after USB disconnected Dual Mount Disabled!
settingsPane.name: DUAL MOUNT USB

settingsPane.description: Here you can run Fix Permissions script by one click! please click one time only, script will finish in 3Min max, no reboot needed.
settingsPane.name: FIX PERMISIONS

settingsPane.description: Misc Settings
settingsPane.name: Misc Settings

spinner.description: WIFI supplicant scan interval, here you can set the time in sec for WIFI to look for access points when ON, Higher the range, less battery used by WIFI! but if you want WIFI to be off on screen OFF, and you set it in ROM settings!, then set it 60sec, if cortex process ON then no problem, will be set by auto and set your setting on screen ON to 360sec and off to 60sec!
spinner.name: WIFI supplicant scan interval

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Android Logger (needs restart)
checkbox.name: Android Logger
checkbox.label: Android Logger

spinner.description: ZRAM Module settings, here you can shutdown ZRAM or add more compressed RAM to System use.
spinner.name: ZRAM Settings

spinner.description: GPS Time Zone for faster LOCK! Use your region to fix GPS location!
spinner.name: GPS Region

button.description: Click to see your current GPS ZONE
button.name: GPS ZONE
button.label: GPS ZONE CHECK

spinner.description: This will set the default I/O scheduler. Default I/O scheduler will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution), and can be overridden by later scripts or apps.
spinner.name: Default I/O Scheduler

checkbox.description: If checked, then kernel function that control the SYNC of file system will work extra time to sync all changes to file system, and save files from damage, but will slightly slow the flash drive, if you want your data to be more secured use this switch.(used in default and performance profiles by default)
checkbox.name: Aggressive Files SYNC
checkbox.label: Data Files Protection

spinner.description: Change USB connection mode. Either leave it as default or force it to mass storage mode (you will see your sdcards as disks) or mtp
spinner.name: USB Mass Storage Mode

checkbox.description: If checked, BetterBatteryStatus will report exclusive (non-overlapping) wakelock statistics.
checkbox.name: Exclusive Wakelock Stats
checkbox.label: Exclusive Wakelock Stats

spinner.description: Charge current setting
spinner.name: Charge Current

spinnerItem.name: AC/Misc:700mA, USB:500mA(risky, may overheat if phone used)

button.description: If you think that the fuel gauge chip is behaving weird use this button to reset it. Give it a few hours after you reset the gauge. It may still show you funny values for that period, Then the battery percentage should be fine.
button.name: Reset Fuel-Gauge Chip
button.label: Reset Fuel-Gauge Chip

settingsPane.description: Remove OR Reinstall ROOT, You can have ROOTED or not ROOTED phone.
settingsPane.name: Remove OR Reinstall Root

button.description: Root Install, Click to install ROOT (SuperUser) + ROM busybox if existed in case you have used the remove button, to Reinstall ROOT first REMOVE it.
button.name: ROOT INSTALL
button.label: INSTALL ROOT

button.description: Root Remove/Uninstall, Click to remove Any ROOT installed + busybox (kernel busybox remain, but hidden from system)
button.name: ROOT REMOVE
button.label: REMOVE ROOT

button.description: Root Check, Click to see if you have ROOT or Not
button.name: ROOT Check
button.label: ROOT CHECK

checkbox.description: If checked, installs root on the next restart.
checkbox.name: Auto-Install Root
checkbox.label: Auto-Install Root

settingsPane.description: Here you can manage cortexbrain-tune script
settingsPane.name: Automation Script tuning.

button.description: Cortex service checker, Click to see if cortexbrain 'background-process' is running or not
button.name: CORTEX Service check
button.label: CHECK SERVICE

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable the 'Auto-Brightness'-function from Cortexbrain-Script. [depends on 'cortexbrain_background_process']
checkbox.name: Auto-Brightness
checkbox.label: Force Auto-Brightness

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable the 'Firewall-Tweaks' from 'cortexbrain-tune.sh'. (reboot needed after change)
checkbox.name: Firewall-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Firewall-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable the 'TCP-Tweaks' from 'cortexbrain-tune.sh'. (reboot needed after change)
checkbox.name: TCP-Tweaks
checkbox.label: TCP-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable the 'Memory-Tweaks' from 'cortexbrain-tune.sh'. (reboot needed after change)
checkbox.name: Memory-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Memory-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable the 'Battery-Tweaks' from 'cortexbrain-tune.sh'. (reboot needed after change)
checkbox.name: Battery-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Battery-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable the 'System-Tweaks' from 'cortexbrain-tune.sh'. (reboot needed after change)
checkbox.name: System-Tweaks
checkbox.label: System-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable the 'Kernel-Tweaks' from 'cortexbrain-tune.sh'. (reboot needed after change)
checkbox.name: Kernel-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Kernel-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable the 'I/O-Tweaks' from 'cortexbrain-tune.sh'. (reboot needed after change)
checkbox.name: I/O-Tweaks
checkbox.label: I/O-Tweaks
